text:
Sun City is a city in Barber County, Kansas, United States, along the Medicine Lodge River. As of the 2010 census, 53 people lived there.
History.
Sun City was founded in 1872. The first post office in Sun City was founded in August 1873.
Geography.
Sun City is at (37.379041, -98.917485).
According to the United States Census Bureau says that the city has a total area of. All of it is land.
Climate.
Sun City has hot, humid summers and generally mild to cool winters. According to the Köppen Climate Classification system says that Sun City has a humid subtropical climate, abbreviated "Cfa" on climate maps.
2010 census.
As of the 2010 census says that there were 53 people, 23 households, and 16 families living in the city.
